author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa flagged off a total of 701 new buses and 65 new small buses at the Secretariat on Monday.

Of the 701 buses, 52 new buses would go for Metropolitan Transport Corporation in Chennai.

65 small buses for Chennai

The 65 new small buses would be operated in 30 routes within Chennai city, an official release stated.

Transport Corporation Zones with offices in Villupuram (97), Salem (85), Coimbatore (93), Kumbakonam (202), Madurai (154) and Tirunelveli (18) have also been allotted new buses. All these buses are worth Rs. 144.47 crore, it stated. Ministers P. Thangamani, C. Vijayabhaskar, Chief Secretary K. Gnanadesikan, advisor to the government Sheela Balakrishnan, Additional Chief Secretary in Transport Department C.V. Sankar were present during the flagging-off event, it added.
title: CM flags off new buses
